intro: Trifolium maritimum var. nigrocinctum, commonly known as the black-bordered clover, is a variant of the common clover species native to coastal regions. It is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, each leaflet having a distinctive black or dark purple margin. This plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils along shorelines and is adapted to salt spray and wind. Its small white or pale pink flowers bloom in spring, adding a delicate touch to coastal landscapes. The variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in stabilizing dune environments.
